title: MySQL
text: MySQL  is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS). MySQL has stand-alone clients that allow users to interact directly with a MySQL database using SQL, but more often, MySQL is used with other programs to implement applications that need relational database capability.

title: Bootstrap 5
text: Bootstrap 5 is the newest version of Bootstrap, which is the most popular HTML, CSS, and JavaScript framework for creating responsive, mobile-first websites. Bootstrap 5 is completely free to download and use.

title: MongoDB
text: MongoDB is an open source NoSQL database management program. MongoDB is a tool that can manage document-oriented information, store or retrieve information. MongoDB supports various forms of data.

title: jQuery
text: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers.
